args.description: - (Optional) The log level that Rundeck should use for this job

args.description:
- (Optional) Boolean defining whether two or more executions of
this job can run concurrently

args.name: max_thread_count
args.description:
- (Optional) The maximum number of threads to use to execute this job, which
controls on how many nodes the commands can be run simulateneously

args.name: continue_on_error
args.description:
- (Optional) Boolean defining whether Rundeck will continue to run
subsequent steps if any intermediate step fails

args.name: rank_attribute
args.description:
- (Optional) The name of the attribute that will be used to decide in which
order the nodes will be visited while executing the job across multiple nodes

args.name: rank_order
args.description:
- (Optional) Keyword deciding which direction the nodes are sorted in terms of
the chosen rank_attribute

args.name: preserve_options_order
args.description:
: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the configured options will
be presented in their configuration order when shown in the Rundeck UI

args.name: command_ordering_strategy
args.description:
: (Optional) The name of the strategy used to describe how to
traverse the matrix of nodes and commands

<a href="http://rundeck

args.name: node_filter_exclude_precedence
args.description:
: (Optional) Boolean controlling a deprecated Rundeck feature that controls
whether node exclusions take priority over inclusions

args.description: : (Optional) Nested block defining an option a user may set when executing this job

args.description: : (Required) Nested block defining one step in the job workflow

args.description:

args.description:

configure the instance

args.description: - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server

args.description:

args.description:

defining one or more files and their contents

args.name: stop_before_destroy
args.description:
- (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully
before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly

args.name: force_delete
args.description:
- (Optional) Whether to force the FlexibleEngine instance to be
forcefully deleted

authenticate with, with all newline characters removed

args.description: - (Optional) The unique nonce to be used for login requests

- (Optional) The base64-encoded body of the signed
request

args.description:
- (Optional) The base64-encoded, JSON serialized

attrs.name: lease_duration
attrs.description:
- The duration in seconds the token will be valid, relative
to the time in lease_start_time

attrs.name: lease_start_time
attrs.description:
- The approximate time at which the token was created,
using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

attrs.name: renewable
attrs.description: - Set to true if the token can be extended through renewal

attrs.name: metadata
attrs.description:
- A map of information returned by the Vault server about the
authentication used to generate this token

attrs.name: auth_type
attrs.description: - The authentication type used to generate this token

attrs.name: policies
attrs.description: - The Vault policies assigned to this token

attrs.name: accessor
attrs.description: - The token's accessor

attrs.name: client_token
attrs.description: - The token returned by Vault

args.name: account_id
args.description: - (Optional) The AWS account ID to configure the STS role for

args.name: sts_role
args.description:
- (Optional) The STS role to assume when verifying requests made

args.description:
- (Optional) The path the AWS auth backend being configured was

args.name: name
args.description: - (Required) A unique name to give the role

args.description: - (Required) The unique name of the Vault mount to configure

args.name: db_name
args.description:
- (Required) The unique name of the database connection to use for

args.name: creation_statements
args.description:
- (Required) The database statements to execute when
creating a user

args.name: revocation_statements
args.description:
- (Optional) The database statements to execute when
revoking a user

args.name: rollback_statements
args.description:
- (Optional) The database statements to execute when

args.name: renew_statements
args.description:
- (Optional) The database statements to execute when

args.description:
- (Optional) The default number of seconds for leases for this
role

args.name: max_ttl
args.description:
- (Optional) The maximum number of seconds for leases for this
role

args.description: - (Required) The virtual machine UUID

args.name: snapshot_name
args.description: - (Required) The name of the snapshot

args.name: description
args.description: - (Required) A description for the snapshot

args.name: memory
args.description:
- (Required) If set to true, a dump of the internal state of the
virtual machine is included in the snapshot

args.name: quiesce
args.description:
- (Required) If set to true, and the virtual machine is powered
on when the snapshot is taken, VMware Tools is used to quiesce the file
system in the virtual machine

args.name: remove_children
args.description:
- (Optional) If set to true, the entire snapshot subtree
is removed when this resource is destroyed

args.name: consolidate
args.description:
- (Optional) If set to true, the delta disks involved in this
snapshot will be consolidated into the parent when this resource is
destroyed
